summary: Surell Brady was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). The documents list Brady's name on payroll and certification reports for various months in 1978, including April, August, and December. These reports detail Brady's annual salary and gross pay during those periods. The documents do not specify Brady's exact role within the SCA, but their presence on payroll documents indicates they were a staff member.
significance: Surell Brady's significance lies in their employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating their involvement in the investigation into the JFK assassination, although the specific nature and extent of their contribution are not detailed in these documents.
